alert.note: Alert for Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 6:01PM EDT until July 11 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT... Heavy rain from yesterday will combine with additional rainfall today to continue flooding over the warned area. The Ashuelot River and its tributaries will remain high with minor flooding expected. Some roads and properties near the river and streams will continue to see flood impacts through this evening. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS... Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from the recent heavy rains to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EDT, Much of this region is expected to see continued impacts from yesterday`s heavy rainfall along with rainfall seen through the day today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keene, Henniker, Swanzey, Winchester, Antrim, Hancock, Bradford, Dublin, Richmond and Harrisville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
